member.name: P:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is active.
member.value: true if this instance is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CancelConversion
member.summary: Cancels the conversion.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.ConvertSqlServerToSQLiteDatabase(System.String,System.String,System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlTableSelectionHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method takes as input the connection string to an SQL Server database and creates a corresponding SQLite database file with a schema derived from the SQL Server database.
member.param: The connection string to the SQL Server database.
The path to the SQLite database file that needs to get created.
The password to use or NULL if no password should be used to encrypt the DB
A handler delegate for progress notifications.
The selection handler that allows the user to select which tables to convert
member.remarks: The method continues asynchronously in the background and the caller returned immediatly.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.ConvertSqlServerDatabaseToSQLiteFile(System.String,System.String,System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlTableSelectionHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Do the entire process of first reading the SQL Server schema, creating a corresponding SQLite schema, and copying all rows from the SQL Server database to the SQLite database.
member.param: The SQL Server connection string
The path to the generated SQLite database file
The password to use or NULL if no password should be used to encrypt the DB
A handler to handle progress notifications.
The selection handler which allows the user to select which tables to convert.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CopyTableRowsToSQLiteDB(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{DbAccess.TableSchema},System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler)
member.summary: Copies table rows from the SQL Server database to the SQLite database.
member.param: The dataset passed from stored procedure
The path to the SQLite database file.
The schema of the SQL Server database.
The password to use for encrypting the file
A handler to handle progress notifications.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CopySqlServerRowsToSQLiteDB(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{DbAccess.TableSchema},System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler)
member.summary: Copies table rows from the SQL Server database to the SQLite database.
member.param: The SQL Server connection string
The path to the SQLite database file.
The schema of the SQL Server database.
The password to use for encrypting the file
A handler to handle progress notifications.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CastValueForColumn(System.Object,DbAccess.ColumnSchema)
member.summary: Used in order to adjust the value received from SQL Server for the SQLite database.
member.param: The value object
The corresponding column schema
member.returns: SQLite adjusted value.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.BuildSQLiteInsert(DbAccess.TableSchema)
member.summary: Creates a command object needed to insert values into a specific SQLite table.
member.param: The table schema object for the table.
member.returns: A command object with the required functionality.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.GetNormalizedName(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Used in order to avoid breaking naming rules (e.g., when a table has a name in SQL Server that cannot be used as a basis for a matching index name in SQLite).
member.param: The name to change if necessary
Used to avoid duplicate names
member.returns: A normalized name

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.GetDbTypeOfColumn(DbAccess.ColumnSchema)
member.summary: Matches SQL Server types to general DB types
member.param: The column schema to use for the match
member.returns: The matched DB type

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.BuildSqlServerTableQuery(DbAccess.TableSchema)
member.summary: Builds a SELECT query for a specific table. Needed in the process of copying rows from the SQL Server database to the SQLite database.
member.param: The table schema of the table for which we need the query.
member.returns: The SELECT query for the table.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CreateSQLiteDatabase(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{DbAccess.TableSchema},System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler)
member.summary: Creates the SQLite database from the schema read from the SQL Server.
member.param: The path to the generated DB file.
The schema of the SQL server database.
The password to use for encrypting the DB or null if non is needed.
A handle for progress notifications.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CreateSQLiteDatabaseOnly(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the SQLite database from the schema read from the SQL Server.
member.param: The path to the generated DB file.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.AddSchemaToSQLiteDatabase(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{DbAccess.TableSchema},System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler)
member.summary: Creates the SQLite database from the schema read from the SQL Server.
member.param: The path to the generated DB file.
The schema of the SQL server database.
The password to use for encrypting the DB or null if non is needed.
A handle for progress notifications.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.AddSQLiteTable(System.Data.SQLite.SQLiteConnection,DbAccess.TableSchema)
member.summary: Creates the CREATE TABLE DDL for SQLite and a specific table.
member.param: The SQLite connection
The table schema object for the table to be generated.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.BuildCreateTableQuery(DbAccess.TableSchema)
member.summary: returns the CREATE TABLE DDL for creating the SQLite table from the specified table schema object.
member.param: The table schema object from which to create the SQL statement.
member.returns: CREATE TABLE DDL for the specified table.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.BuildCreateIndex(System.String,DbAccess.IndexSchema)
member.summary: Creates a CREATE INDEX DDL for the specified table and index schema.
member.param: The name of the indexed table.
The schema of the index object
member.returns: A CREATE INDEX DDL (SQLite format).

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.BuildColumnStatement(DbAccess.ColumnSchema,DbAccess.TableSchema,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Used when creating the CREATE TABLE DDL. Creates a single row for the specified column.
member.param: The column schema
member.returns: A single column line to be inserted into the general CREATE TABLE DDL statement

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.DiscardNational(System.String)
member.summary: Discards the national prefix if exists (e.g., N'sometext') which is not supported in SQLite.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.IsValidDefaultValue(System.String)
member.summary: Check if the DEFAULT clause is valid by SQLite standards

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.StripParens(System.String)
member.summary: Strip any parentheses from the string.
member.param: The string to strip
member.returns: The stripped string

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.ReadSqlServerSchema(System.String,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler,DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlTableSelectionHandler)
member.summary: Reads the entire SQL Server DB schema using the specified connection string.
member.param: The connection string used for reading SQL Server schema.
A handler for progress notifications.
The selection handler which allows the user to select which tables to convert.
member.returns: List of table schema objects for every table in the SQL Server database.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CheckCancelled
member.summary: Convenience method for checking if the conversion progress needs to be cancelled.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CreateTableSchema(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a TableSchema object using the specified SQL Server connection and the name of the table for which we need to create the schema.
member.param: The SQL Server connection to use
The name of the table for which we wants to create the table schema.
member.returns: A table schema object that represents our knowledge of the table schema

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.ValidateDataType(System.String)
member.summary: Small validation method to make sure we don't miss anything without getting an exception.
member.param: The datatype to validate.

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.FixDefaultValueString(System.String)
member.summary: Does some necessary adjustments to a value string that appears in a column DEFAULT clause.
member.param: The original default value string (as read from SQL Server).
member.returns: Adjusted DEFAULT value string (for SQLite)

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.BuildIndexSchema(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds an index schema object from the specified components (Read from SQL Server).
member.param: The name of the index
The description of the index
Key columns that are part of the index.
member.returns: An index schema object that represents our knowledge of the index

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.AdjustDefaultValue(System.String)
member.summary: More adjustments for the DEFAULT value clause.
member.param: The value to adjust
member.returns: Adjusted DEFAULT value string

member.name: M:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite.CreateSQLiteConnectionString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates SQLite connection string from the specified DB file path.
member.param: The path to the SQLite database file.
member.returns: SQLite connection string

member.name: T:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlServerToSQLite
member.summary: This class is responsible to take a single SQL Server database and convert it to an SQLite database file.
member.remarks: The class knows how to convert table and index structures only.

member.name: T:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler
member.summary: This handler is called whenever a progress is made in the conversion process.
member.param: TRUE indicates that the entire conversion process is finished.
TRUE indicates that the current step finished successfully.
Progress percent (0-100)
A message that accompanies the progress.

member.name: T:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlTableSelectionHandler
member.summary: This handler allows the user to change which tables get converted from SQL Server to SQLite.
member.param: The original SQL Server DB schema
member.returns: The same schema minus any table we don't want to convert.

member.name: T:DbAccess.DbAccess.SqlQueryHandler
member.summary: This handler is called whenever a progress is made in the conversion process.
member.param: TRUE indicates that the entire conversion process is finished.
TRUE indicates that the current step finished successfully.
Progress percent (0-100)
A message that accompanies the progress.

member.name: P:DbAccess.clsLogTools.FileLogDebugEnabled
member.summary: Tells calling program file debug status
member.returns: TRUE if debug level enabled for file logger; FALSE otherwise

member.name: M:DbAccess.clsLogTools.WriteLog(DbAccess.clsLogTools.LoggerTypes,DbAccess.clsLogTools.LogLevels,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the logging system
member.param: Type of logger to use
Level of log reporting
Message to be logged

member.name: M:DbAccess.clsLogTools.WriteLog(DbAccess.clsLogTools.LoggerTypes,DbAccess.clsLogTools.LogLevels,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Overload to write a message and exception to the logging system
member.param: Type of logger to use
Level of log reporting
Message to be logged
Exception to be logged

member.name: M:DbAccess.clsLogTools.ChangeLogFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the base log file name
member.param: Log file base name and path (relative to program folder)

member.name: M:DbAccess.clsLogTools.FindAppenders(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the specified appender
member.param: Name of appender to find
member.returns: List(IAppender) objects if found; NOTHING otherwise

member.name: M:DbAccess.clsLogTools.SetFileLogLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the file logging level via an integer value (Overloaded)
member.param: Integer corresponding to level (1-5, 5 being most verbose

member.name: M:DbAccess.clsLogTools.SetFileLogLevel(DbAccess.clsLogTools.LogLevels)
member.summary: Sets file logging level based on enumeration (Overloaded)
member.param: LogLevels value defining level (Debug is most verbose)

member.name: T:DbAccess.SqliteToAccess
member.summary: This class is responsible to take a single SQL Server database and convert it to an SQLite database file.
member.remarks: The class knows how to convert table and index structures only.

member.name: T:DbAccess.SqlConversionHandler
member.summary: This handler is called whenever a progress is made in the conversion process.
member.param: TRUE indicates that the entire conversion process is finished.
TRUE indicates that the current step finished successfully.
Progress percent (0-100)
A message that accompanies the progress.

member.summary: This handler allows the user to change which tables get converted from SQL Server to SQLite.
member.param: The original SQL Server DB schema
